title: The Science Behind Ideal Weight
excerpt: Understanding BMI, Robinson, Miller, and Devine formulas. How we calculate your ideal weight metrics accurately.
content:
"Ideal weight" is a controversial term, but medically used formulas can provide a general guideline for healthy weight ranges. Our calculator uses four distinct formulas to give you a comprehensive view.

The Formulas

  • Robinson (1983): Originally designed for drug dosage calculations.
  • Miller (1983): Often used to estimate lean body mass.
  • Devine (1974): The most widely used formula for medical dosages.
  • Hamwi (1964): A field rule of thumb for quick estimates.

Remember, these are just estimates. Always consult a healthcare professional for personalized advice.

title: Web Assembly: The Next Big Thing?
excerpt: Why major tech companies are betting big on Wasm for browser-based performance.
content:
WebAssembly (Wasm) is unlocking a new era of web performance, allowing code written in languages like C++, Rust, and Go to run in the browser at near-native speed.

Why It Matters

Traditionally, JavaScript has been the only language of the browser. Wasm changes that, enabling high-performance applications like video editors, 3D games, and complex scientific simulations to run directly in your favorite web browser.

SuperTools & Wasm

Our Image Converter and PDF Merger tools already utilize WebAssembly components to process files locally on your device, ensuring maximum speed and privacy.
